definitions: To successfully complete or deal with a difficult or unpleasant experience or period of time.
To use up or finish a supply of something.
To make contact with someone by phone or other communication device.
To make someone understand or accept something.
examples: I don't know how I'm going to get through this week.
We got through a whole box of cookies.
I tried calling her, but I couldn't get through.
It's hard to get through to him sometimes.
pastTenses: got through sth, gotten through sth
